results.title: Hovercraft
results.creator_credit: Peter Bennet Stone, John Read and Brith Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The story of Christopher Cockerell and of his invention, the Hovercraft. Tells how he developed the principle while running a small boatyard on the Norfolk Broads and how after many attempts the idea was adapted by industry. Describes the construction and operation of the latest British Hovercraft made by four different firms, and a high speed journey along the coast of the Isle of Wight.

results.title: Hoverbug
results.creator_credit: Jan Darnley-Smith, George H. Brown and Fanfare Films
results.brief_description: Young Dick and Jenny Brewster are trying to build a small hovercraft to enter into a race. Mr Watts, an eccentric inventor, offers his help. Charley Guthridge and his mate Sidney plot to prevent Dick and Jenny from building their home-made hovercraft. On the day of the big race, Dick and Jenny stuggle to take the lead and beat their opponents. Stars Jill Riddick; John Trayhorn; Francis Attard; Gary Cann; Arthur Howard; Michael Balfour; Jan Butlin; Peter Myers; Cardew Robinson; Michael Segal; Harold Goodwin; Marianne Stone; and Janet Waldron.

results.title: Housing in Scotland
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Gunn, Great Britain. Ministry of Information and Merlin Films
results.brief_description: Recalls Scotland’s efforts in pioneering housing schemes and gives details of the immediate postwar plans for building. Looks at temporary structures, to meet emergency needs; two-family dwellings which can later be converted into single dwellings; and permanent modern homes. Although the film deals with a serious subject, its approach is occasionaly light and humourous.

results.brief_description: Describes the complexities and intricacies of preparing and transporting a house for relocation. Suitable for upper and lower secondary levels.

results.title: House that Jack built
results.brief_description: An information film on the operation of the Local Building Trade Apprenticeship Scheme in England. Shows high school students working as laborers at a housing project construction site as part of a work experience scheme.

results.title: House of treasures: the magic eye
results.brief_description: Illustrates the development of photographic technology through an exposition of archival photos of colonial Australia. Reveals some of the techniques and processes used in early photographic work, and highlights several old cameras. Quaint and static in its exploration of historical depiction of idiomatic Australia. Narrated by Noel Brophy.

results.title: House of knowledge
results.creator_credit: Larry O'Reilly and RKO Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: A panoramic study of the Smithsonian Institution, which supplies its immense collection of art and museum pieces largely by its own exploration and searching. Mentions briefly ethnology, biology, entomology and other sciences - giving glimpses of work in each field. Shows field teams investigating a new volcano, and archaeologists in Mexico.

results.title: House afire
results.brief_description: A short instructional cautionary film describing the dangers of fire - particularly bushfires during the 1950s and 1960s, accompanied by footage of the fires. A narrator details simple ways in which house holders can protect their homes against destruction.

results.title: Houdini
results.creator_credit: Pen Densham, Leanne Moore, Trilogy Entertainment Group and Turner Network Television
results.brief_description: The life story of Harry Houdini is dramatically presented in “Houdini”. From his humble beginnings pressing garments during the day and mastering his skills as an illusionist at night, the character of Houdini evolves. One fateful night he meets Bess (Stacy Edwards) and asks her to marry him the same day. The pair marry and Bess joins him on stage as his assistant. Houdini soon realises that to be the greatest, he must convince the audience he will die. From this premise, the legend of Houdini is born. This feature successfully portrays both the legend and the man, with interesting insights into Houdini’s struggle for the love and acceptance of his mother and the great burden this places on his marriage. As Houdini ages, he becomes obsessed with the existence of the after life, vowing to escape death as he escapes.

results.title: Hotel du Lac
results.creator_credit: Giles Foster, Sue Birtwistle and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: After narrowly avoiding an unsuitable marriage, a woman novelist retreats to an elegant Swiss hotel in the off-season, where she ponders her life whilst carefully observing her fellow guests. A nicely paced and detailed adaptation of a Booker Prize-winning novel, by Anita Brookner, filmed amidst the lakes and mountains of Switzerland. Stars Anna Massey and Denholm Elliott.
